Configuration for https://turbowarp.org/
You can move, resize, and minimize this comment, but don't edit it by hand. This comment can be deleted to remove the stored settings.
{"framerate":60,"width":270,"height":585} // _twconfig_

TEXT: Welcome. Tell me, What's your OS?
Welcome. Please select the virtual OS you would like to install.
Welcome back. Please select the virtual OS you would like to install.

PLEASE download VMWare Workstation 17, the MacOS ISO, and the unlocker before continuing. Links and images will be at the bottom. Once you have installed VMWare, you must run the unlocker first. To do this you must extract it, then right click 'win-install.cmd' and click run as administrator. When finished, you must now open VMWare. Click create a new virtual machine. Select 'installer disk image file (iso):' and click browse. Then select the macos ISO you just downloaded. Then click next. Check that the Version says macos. Doesn't matter what macos version just as long as it says macos. Click next. Name your virtual machine and click next. Set how much storage you want your macos to have. I recommend 80 or more. Select 'store virtual disk as a single file.' Click next. Check that your settings are correct. Click finish. Now click 'play virtual machine.' When your mac loads, select your language. Then double click disk utility. When open, select VMWare 'Virtual SATA Hard Drive Media'. At the top right click Erase and then click erase again. When finished click done and close out of disk utility. Now double click Install MacOS Ventura. Click Continue. Click Agree and click agree again. Select the Harddrive and click continue. When everything finishes, congratulations! You just installed a virtual MacOS.
Welcome. Please select the virtual OS you would like to install.

PLEASE download VMWare Workstation 17 and the Windows ISO before continuing. Links and images will be at the bottom. First you must install VMWare. Once you have done this, you must open it and create a new virtual machine. Then select install disk image file (iso) and select the iso you have downloaded. Click next. Name your virtual machine and click next. When select your encryption type select the 2nd option. Set your password and make sure to check "remember the password." Click next. Now select your disk size. I recommend 64 GB or higher. Click next. Make sure that everything is setup correctly and check the 'Power on this virtual machine' option. Click Finish. When your virtual machine boots up your may see some text that says time out. This is normal. Just wait a few minutes until our see a blue screen with different options. Select Manual Boot and hit enter. Then when your windows screen boots up select your language and click next. Click Install Now. Seect the type of windows 11 you would like to install and click next. Agree to the terms and conditions and click next. Double click on custom. Select drive 0 and click next. Wait for windows to install and that's it! You now have a Windows 11 Virtual Machine.
